title: Indian Polity
description: Master Indian Constitution, Governance, and Political System

topics.title: The Preamble: Master Module (Complete Notes, Mnemonics, Flashcards & 100 MCQs)
topics.description: Comprehensive, exam-focused Preamble notes with mnemonics and 100 practice MCQs.

content.title: Preamble Complete Data & Mnemonic Guide (Read Once, Remember Always)

body.preamble_text: WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC and to secure to all its citizens: JUSTICE, social, economic and political; LIBERTY of thought, expression, belief, faith and worship; EQUALITY of status and of opportunity; and to promote among them all FRATERNITY assuring the dignity of the individual and the unity and integrity of the Nation; IN OUR CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY this twenty-sixth day of November, 1949, do HEREBY ADOPT, ENACT AND GIVE TO OURSELVES THIS CONSTITUTION.
body.essence: The Preamble is the philosophical and political essence (soul/identity) of the Constitution. It states the source of authority, the nature of state, the objectives of the Constitution, and the date of adoption.

foundation_and_history.based_on: Objectives Resolution (moved by Jawaharlal Nehru on 13 December 1946).
foundation_and_history.enactment_note: Preamble was enacted after the rest of the Constitution to ensure conformity.
foundation_and_history.amendment_history: Only amended by the 42nd Amendment (1976) which added the words Socialist, Secular and Integrity (to 'Unity').

judicial_history_summary.Berubari Union Case (1960): Held that the Preamble is NOT a part of the Constitution (earlier view).
judicial_history_summary.Kesavananda Bharati Case (1973): Held that the Preamble IS a part of the Constitution and embodies the Basic Structure; marks the modern position.
judicial_history_summary.LIC of India Case (1995): Reaffirmed that the Preamble is an integral part of the Constitution.

nature_of_state.mnemonic: SSCDR ‚Üí 'Strong Sexy Smart Desi Raja' (Sovereign Socialst Secular Democratic Republic).

definitions.Sovereign: Independent in internal and external affairs; not subordinate to any external power.
definitions.Socialist: Democratic socialism (added by 42nd Amendment) ‚Äî aims to reduce socio-economic inequality; mixed economy model.
definitions.Secular: State has no official religion and treats all religions impartially (added by 42nd Amendment).
definitions.Democratic: People hold political power directly or via representatives; representative parliamentary democracy.
definitions.Republic: Head of state is elected (not hereditary).

best_trick.Sovereign: Visual: A strong gate that won't open for outsiders ‚Äî 'Apne Faisle Khud'.
best_trick.Socialist: Visual: Equal plates of food for everyone ‚Äî 'Aadmi Barabar'.
best_trick.Secular: Visual: Different faith symbols on an equal-scale balance ‚Äî 'Sab Dharam Barabar'.
best_trick.Democratic: Visual: Ballot box with many hands ‚Äî 'Vote Se Sarkar'.
best_trick.Republic: Visual: A President‚Äôs sash passed by election, not inheritance ‚Äî 'Vansh Anugat Nahi'.

Justice.explain: Social justice tackles social discrimination, economic justice addresses wealth inequalities, political justice guarantees political rights.

Liberty.explain: Five-fold liberty (TEBFW) ‚Äî protected but subject to constitutional limits (reasonable restrictions).

Equality.explain: No special privileges; equal opportunities for all citizens.

assurances: Unity and Integrity of the Nation
Fraternity.explain: Promotes brotherhood, national unity and removes feelings of discrimination.

best_tricks.Justice: Mnemonic SEP ‚Üí 'Sexy Exams Party' to recall Social, Economic, Political.
best_tricks.Liberty: Mnemonic TEBFW ‚Üí 'Thali Egg Bag Fan Water' ‚Äî one cue per liberty type.
best_tricks.Fraternity: Visual: People holding hands around a map ‚Äî 'Dignity + Unity'.

legal_significance_and_usage.interpretation_role: Preamble is used to interpret ambiguous provisions of the Constitution; it represents the basic philosophy (helps in purposive interpretation).
legal_significance_and_usage.justiciability: Conference of view historically changed ‚Äî currently the Preamble is treated as part of the Constitution and core to the Basic Structure doctrine (Kesavananda), though not all of it is directly enforceable as a right.
legal_significance_and_usage.amendability: Preamble can be amended as held in Kesavananda (subject to not violating Basic Structure). Note: 42nd Amendment altered its language in 1976.

famous_quotes.quote: Political Horoscope (Rajneetik Kundli) of the Constitution

content.mnemonic: SSCDR (Nature) and JLEF (Objectives) with Hinglish Jugaad cues

flashcards.q: What is the source of authority mentioned in the Preamble?
flashcards.a: We, The People of India (sovereignty rests with the people).
flashcards.tip: Think 'People power' ‚Äî Preamble begins with 'WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA'.

flashcards.q: List the five words describing the nature of the Indian state.
What are the components of 'Justice' in the Preamble?
flashcards.a: Social Justice, Economic Justice and Political Justice.
Thought, Expression, Belief, Faith and Worship (TEBFW).
flashcards.tip: TEBFW cue words: Thali Egg Bag Fan Water.

flashcards.q: What does 'Republic' in the Preamble signify?
flashcards.a: The head of state is elected, not hereditary.
flashcards.tip: Vansh Anugat Nahi ‚Äî President by election.

flashcards.q: Which case held Preamble is part of the Constitution and laid Basic Structure?
Which case earlier said Preamble is not part of the Constitution?
What two assurances does Fraternity provide?
flashcards.a: Dignity of the individual and Unity & Integrity of the Nation.
flashcards.tip: Dignity + Unity visual of people & map.

quiz.prompt: The Preamble is based on which resolution?
quiz.reason: The Preamble is based on the Objectives Resolution moved by Jawaharlal Nehru on 13 Dec 1946.

quiz.prompt: When was the Preamble adopted?
quiz.reason: It was adopted by the Constituent Assembly on 26 November 1949.

quiz.prompt: When did the Constitution come into effect?
quiz.reason: Constitution came into force on 26 January 1950.

quiz.prompt: Which Amendment added the words 'Socialist' and 'Secular' to the Preamble?
quiz.reason: The 42nd Amendment (1976) added 'Socialist', 'Secular' and 'Integrity'.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is NOT one of the words describing the nature of the Indian State in the Preamble?
quiz.reason: Preamble says Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic ‚Äî not 'Federal'.

quiz.prompt: What does 'Sovereign' in the Preamble mean?
options: India is subordinate to other nations
India has internal and external independence
India is a dominion of UK
quiz.reason: Sovereign implies freedom to conduct internal and external affairs.

quiz.prompt: How many types of 'Justice' are mentioned in the Preamble?
quiz.reason: Justice is social, economic and political ‚Äî three types.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is NOT one of the five liberties mentioned in the Preamble?
quiz.reason: Liberty list is Thought, Expression, Belief, Faith and Worship ‚Äî 'Wealth' is not included.

quiz.prompt: Which case held that the Preamble is not a part of the Constitution?
quiz.reason: Berubari Union Case (1960) earlier held Preamble was not part of the Constitution.

quiz.prompt: Which case declared the Preamble to be part of the Constitution and part of Basic Structure?
quiz.reason: Kesavananda Bharati (1973) held Preamble is part of the Constitution and forms part of Basic Structure.

quiz.prompt: The Preamble assures 'Fraternity' to secure which of the following?
options: Dignity of the individual and Unity & Integrity of the Nation
quiz.reason: Fraternity assures dignity and unity & integrity of the Nation.

quiz.prompt: Which of these words was added to the Preamble by the 42nd Amendment?
quiz.reason: Socialist (and Secular & Integrity) were added by the 42nd Amendment.

quiz.prompt: Which phrase indicates the source of authority in the Preamble?
quiz.reason: Preamble begins with 'We, The People of India'.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best captures 'Republic' as used in the Preamble?
options: Head of state is a hereditary monarch
Head of state is elected and not hereditary
Head of state is appointed by foreign power
Head of state is a divine ruler
quiz.reason: Republic means the Head of State is elected and not hereditary.

quiz.prompt: Which one of the following is a function of the Preamble?
options: Provide an exhaustive list of all laws
State the guiding philosophy and help in interpretation
quiz.reason: Preamble sets out the guiding philosophy and guides interpretation where necessary.

quiz.prompt: What does 'Liberty of belief' refer to in the Preamble?
options: Freedom to choose one's religion or belief
Freedom to practice only state religion
quiz.reason: Liberty includes freedom of belief, allowing individuals to hold beliefs freely.

quiz.prompt: Which element in the Preamble was explicitly added to emphasize the integrity of the nation?
quiz.reason: The word 'Integrity' (to 'Unity') was added by the 42nd Amendment.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is NOT an objective mentioned in the Preamble?
quiz.reason: Supremacy of a hereditary monarch is not an objective; the Preamble supports Republic not monarchy.

quiz.prompt: The phrase 'Unity and Integrity of the Nation' in the Preamble connects most closely with which objective?
quiz.reason: Fraternity assures dignity and unity & integrity of the Nation.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is true about the Preamble's justiciability?
options: It was always treated as enforceable law
It is never referred to in court judgments
Its status evolved ‚Äî courts treat it as part of the Constitution for interpretive purposes
quiz.reason: Judicial position evolved; the Preamble is used by courts to interpret the Constitution and is considered part of it in modern jurisprudence.

quiz.prompt: Which word indicates the state's commitment to economic equality in the Preamble (post amendment)?
quiz.reason: The addition of 'Socialist' emphasizes the aim of economic equality.

quiz.prompt: Which date is explicitly mentioned in the Preamble text?
quiz.reason: The Preamble includes the adoption date ‚Äî 26th November 1949.

quiz.prompt: Preamble term: 'Democratic' primarily refers to:
options: Rule by the people through elected representatives
quiz.reason: Democratic indicates popular rule, exercised directly or via representatives.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following pairs belong to the Preamble's definitional sequence 'nature of state'?
quiz.reason: Socialist and Secular are part of the five words (SSCDR).

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best describes the phrase 'We the People' in the Preamble?
quiz.reason: 'We the People' denotes that the Constitution derives authority from the people.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is an appropriate short mnemonic for the Preamble's objectives?
quiz.reason: JLEF stands for Justice, Liberty, Equality, Fraternity ‚Äî the Preamble objectives.

quiz.prompt: Which case reaffirmed Preamble as integral part of Constitution in 1995?
quiz.reason: LIC of India case (1995) reaffirmed Preamble's integral status.

quiz.prompt: The Preamble's phrase 'to secure to all its citizens' most directly signals:
options: Universal aims and goals for all citizens
quiz.reason: It lays down constitutional aims to be secured for all citizens.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is a correct shorthand for the five liberties listed under 'Liberty'?
quiz.reason: TEBFW was used as a memory cue: Thought, Expression, Belief, Faith, Worship.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best sums up the role of the Preamble?
options: A binding statute replacing all laws
A philosophical and interpretive guide to the Constitution
quiz.reason: Preamble provides the philosophical framework and aids constitutional interpretation.

quiz.prompt: Which word in the Preamble conveys equal treatment of religions by the State?
quiz.reason: Secular means the State treats all religions impartially.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following two assurances are contained under 'Fraternity' in the Preamble?
options: Dignity of the individual and unity & integrity of the Nation
quiz.reason: Fraternity ensures dignity and national unity & integrity.

quiz.prompt: Which modification to the Preamble was made by the 42nd Amendment besides 'Socialist' and 'Secular'?
quiz.reason: 42nd Amendment added the word 'Integrity' after 'Unity'.

quiz.prompt: In mnemonic terms, what does SSCDR stand for?
quiz.reason: SSCDR is short for Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic.

quiz.prompt: What is the practical effect of Preamble for courts?
options: Courts use it to interpret ambiguous provisions
Courts must enforce it like a criminal law
quiz.reason: Courts refer to Preamble to resolve constitutional ambiguities and ascertain intent.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is a correct triad for Justice under the Preamble?
quiz.reason: Justice comprises social, economic and political justice.

quiz.prompt: Which one is a famous description of the Preamble by N.A. Palkiwala?
options: The Preamble is the Constitution's appendix
The Preamble is the Identity Card of the Constitution
The Preamble is a legislative power
quiz.reason: Palkiwala described the Preamble as the Identity Card of the Constitution.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is correct about the Preamble's amendment?
options: It was amended once by the 42nd Amendment
It was replaced by a new Preamble in 1980
quiz.reason: It was amended once by the 42nd Amendment, 1976.

quiz.prompt: Which part of the Constitution most directly implements the objectives of the Preamble?
options: Part III ‚Äî Fundamental Rights and Part IV ‚Äî DPSP
quiz.reason: Fundamental Rights (Part III) and Directive Principles (Part IV) together work to achieve Preamble aims.

quiz.prompt: Preamble's 'Liberty of Expression' is directly connected to which Constitutional provision?
quiz.reason: Article 19 guarantees freedom of speech and expression.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best explains the relationship between Preamble and Basic Structure?
options: Preamble is outside the Basic Structure
Preamble embodies values that are part of the Basic Structure
Preamble is a mere preface with no value
quiz.reason: Kesavananda held Preamble contains the core values that form part of Basic Structure.

quiz.prompt: Which phrase in the Preamble indicates the goal of social equality?
quiz.reason: Social justice is explicitly mentioned in the Preamble.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is the best short mnemonic to remember the five liberties of the Preamble?
quiz.reason: TEBFW is used to recall Thought, Expression, Belief, Faith and Worship.

quiz.prompt: The Preamble's 'We, the People' suggests which constitutional principle?
quiz.reason: 'We, the People' denotes that the Constitution's authority originates from the people (popular sovereignty).

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best captures the Preamble's approach to religion?
options: Secular ‚Äî equal respect to all religions
quiz.reason: Secularism in the Preamble implies equal respect for all religions.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is an effect of including 'Socialist' into the Preamble?
options: Highlights the commitment to reduce inequality and pursue social justice
quiz.reason: Addition of 'Socialist' stresses socio-economic fairness; not identical to USSR-style socialism.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is a correct description of 'Basic Structure' doctrine in relation to Preamble?
options: Basic Structure includes core values expressed in the Preamble and cannot be destroyed by amendment
Basic Structure is a criminal law
Basic Structure is a taxation provision
quiz.reason: Kesavananda established that constitutional amendments cannot destroy the Basic Structure, which Preamble helps define.

quiz.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT directly a Preamble objective?
quiz.reason: Royal privilege is not an objective; Preamble protects equality and democracy.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is a helpful trick to remember 'Justice' types?
quiz.reason: SEP is the suggested mnemonic for justice types.

quiz.prompt: Which word in the Preamble signals a commitment to democracy?
quiz.reason: 'Democratic' indicates commitment to democracy.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best describes Preamble's status after Kesavananda?
options: It is merely a decorative preface
A guiding part of the Constitution and linked to Basic Structure
Has no relationship to Fundamental Rights
quiz.reason: Kesavananda elevated Preamble to be part of the Constitution's core guiding principles.

quiz.prompt: What is the relationship between Article 19 (freedom of speech) and the Preamble?
options: Article 19 gives statutory shape to the liberty guaranteed by Preamble
quiz.reason: Preamble's liberty is given concrete expression by Article 19 and similar provisions.

quiz.prompt: Which one of these is the best short mnemonic to remember the Preamble's nature (SSCDR)?
quiz.reason: The mnemonic 'Strong Sexy Smart Desi Raja' is used to remember SSCDR.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following statements about Preamble is CORRECT?
options: Preamble is a source of law like statutes
Preamble cannot be used by courts at all
Preamble is a guiding instrument that courts use to interpret the Constitution
quiz.reason: Preamble is a guiding instrument for interpretation.

quiz.prompt: Which of these describes the 'adoption' vs 'effect' of the Constitution?
options: Adopted 26 Nov 1949; came into effect 26 Jan 1950
Adopted and effective on same date 26 Nov 1949
quiz.reason: Adoption date is 26 Nov 1949; effect (coming into force) 26 Jan 1950.

quiz.prompt: Which is a correct summary of the Preamble's aim?
options: To secure privileges for the elite
To secure Justice, Liberty, Equality and Fraternity for all citizens
To invite foreign powers to rule India
quiz.reason: Preamble's aim is to secure JLEF to all citizens.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best describes 'Liberty of thought'?
options: Freedom to form and hold opinions without coercion
quiz.reason: Liberty of thought allows individuals freedom to form opinions.

quiz.prompt: What important judicial doctrine relates to the Preamble and prevents destruction of core values?
quiz.reason: The Basic Structure doctrine (Kesavananda) prevents amendment destroying core constitutional values including those in Preamble.

quiz.prompt: Which of these best describes the Preamble's language after 42nd Amendment?
options: Changed 'We the people' to 'We the Parliament'
quiz.reason: 42nd Amendment inserted 'Socialist', 'Secular' and 'Integrity'.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following helps memorize the liberties (TEBFW)?
quiz.reason: TEBFW is the mnemonic given (Thali Egg Bag Fan Water) to cue Thought, Expression, Belief, Faith, Worship.

quiz.prompt: What is the relation between Directive Principles (DPSP) and the Preamble?
options: DPSP help realize social and economic goals of Preamble
quiz.reason: Directive Principles (Part IV) aim to realize the Preamble's social and economic objectives.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is true about the Preamble and Fundamental Rights?
options: Fundamental Rights are independent of Preamble
Fundamental Rights and Preamble are unrelated
Fundamental Rights implement the liberty and equality aims of Preamble
quiz.reason: Fundamental Rights provide legal protection to the liberties and equality envisaged by the Preamble.

quiz.prompt: Which one of these is an accurate short-cue to recall 'Justice types'?
quiz.reason: SEP stands for Social, Economic and Political justice.

quiz.prompt: Which famous jurist called the Preamble the 'Identity Card' of the Constitution?
quiz.reason: N. A. Palkiwala called the Preamble the Identity Card of the Constitution.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is TRUE regarding the 'Unity' in 'Unity & Integrity'?
options: Refers to territorial unity and national solidarity
quiz.reason: Unity & Integrity denote territorial and national unity and harmony.

quiz.prompt: Which part of the Preamble provides the date 'in our constituent assembly this twenty-sixth day of November, 1949'?
quiz.reason: The closing clause of the Preamble includes the date of adoption.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is the MOST exam-friendly summary of the Preamble?
options: SSCDR + JLEF + adoption date (26 Nov 1949) + 42nd amendment additions
Only the preface to the constitution
quiz.reason: SSCDR (nature), JLEF (objectives), key dates and 42nd amendment additions form the exam summary.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best describes 'social justice' as per Preamble?
options: Eliminating discrimination and ensuring social equity
quiz.reason: Social justice aims to remove social discrimination and inequalities.

quiz.prompt: Which of these best represents the mnemonic used for the Preamble's nature (SSCDR)?
quiz.reason: That's the Hinglish mnemonic suggested to remember SSCDR.

quiz.prompt: Which of these best captures 'Equality of opportunity'?
options: Same status for all regardless of talent
Equal chance to compete and access resources
quiz.reason: Equality of opportunity means equal access to opportunities and not preferential privileges.

quiz.prompt: Which of these does the Preamble primarily reflect?
options: The social, political and ethical values of the constitution makers
quiz.reason: Preamble expresses the core values motivating the Constitution.

quiz.prompt: Which historical document influenced the Preamble's framing?
quiz.reason: The Objectives Resolution (moved by Nehru) is the direct basis of Preamble.

quiz.prompt: Which of following is a correct technique to memorize Preamble facts?
options: Hinglish Mnemonics (Jugaad) associating words with images
Ignore the text and learn only questions
quiz.reason: Hinglish mnemonics and visual associations help long-term recall (method used here).

quiz.prompt: Which of the following statements is CORRECT about the Preamble and amendments?
options: Preamble cannot be amended at all
Preamble has been amended once (42nd Amendment) and may be amended but not to destroy Basic Structure
quiz.reason: Preamble amended once; Basic Structure doctrine protects core features against destructive amendment.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is a short flashcard tip for remembering the adoption/effect dates?
quiz.reason: Adoption 26 Nov 1949; effective 26 Jan 1950 (Republic Day).

quiz.prompt: Which famous phrase captures the Preamble's beginning?
quiz.reason: The Preamble begins with 'We, The People of India'.

quiz.prompt: Which of these best captures the link between Preamble and Fundamental Duties (Part IVA)?
options: Fundamental Duties are expressions of Preamble's spirit and aim to promote Fraternity and civic responsibility
quiz.reason: Fundamental Duties aim to cultivate values consistent with Preamble's spirit.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is a correct short-hand to recall the five words describing nature of state?
quiz.reason: SSCDR is the shorthand for the five words of the state's nature.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is the best one-line definition of Preamble?
options: An introductory statement setting out objectives and philosophical basis of the Constitution
quiz.reason: Preamble is an introductory statement of objectives and philosophy.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is true about the addition of 'Integrity' in the Preamble?
options: Added to emphasize territorial integrity and unity
quiz.reason: 'Integrity' was added (42nd Amendment) to emphasize unity & territorial integrity.

quiz.prompt: Which one of the following is NOT a component of the Preamble's objectives?
quiz.reason: Monarchical rule is contrary to the Preamble's republican and democratic aims.

quiz.prompt: Which one of the following indicates the Preamble's influence on interpretation?
options: Courts can use Preamble's language to construe ambiguous constitutional provisions
Preamble is used to issue tax orders
quiz.reason: Courts use the Preamble to guide interpretation of ambiguous provisions.

quiz.prompt: Which of these best explains 'Political Justice' as in the Preamble?
options: Right to vote and participate in political process
Right to property for the elite
quiz.reason: Political justice ensures political rights like franchise and eligibility to be elected.

quiz.prompt: Which mnemonic helps remember the Preamble's 'nature' sequence?
options: SSCDR ‚Üí Strong Sexy Smart Desi Raja
quiz.reason: SSCDR with Hinglish cues is the recommended mnemonic.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following phrases from Preamble explicitly expresses the intent to establish justice?
options: Having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a ... Republic and to secure to all its citizens JUSTICE, social, economic and political
quiz.reason: The Preamble states its intent to secure JUSTICE (social, economic and political).

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is an example of a flashcard tip included in the notes?
options: Remember adoption and effect dates as 26 Nov and 26 Jan
quiz.reason: One flashcard tip: adoption 26 Nov 1949; effect 26 Jan 1950.

quiz.prompt: Which of these best describes the Preamble's tone?
quiz.reason: Preamble is a philosophical and purposive introductory statement.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is an accurate 'best trick' for remembering 'Fraternity' assurances?
options: Visualize people holding hands around the nation to recall dignity and unity
quiz.reason: Visual mnemonics help recall Fraternity's assurances: dignity and unity & integrity.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is the best way to recall 'Liberty' items quickly?
options: TEBFW (Thali, Egg, Bag, Fan, Water) to cue Thought, Expression, Belief, Faith, Worship
quiz.reason: TEBFW is provided as the memory cue for the five liberties.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is an accurate recollection: the Preamble's nature sequence & objectives?
quiz.reason: SSCDR (nature) & JLEF (objectives) are the shorthand cues.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following statements about the Objectives Resolution is correct?
options: It was moved by Jawaharlal Nehru on 13 Dec 1946 and formed basis for Preamble
It was enacted in 1950 by Parliament
It is unrelated to the Preamble
quiz.reason: Objectives Resolution by Nehru (13 Dec 1946) was the base for the Preamble.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is true regarding the word 'Integrity' in the Preamble?
options: Added in 1976 to emphasize territorial integrity along with unity
Was used to create a monarchy
quiz.reason: Integrity was added by 42nd Amendment to emphasize territorial integrity along with unity.

quiz.prompt: Which of these is an example of how courts use the Preamble?
options: To interpret ambiguous constitutional provisions in line with declared objectives
quiz.reason: Courts use Preamble as interpretive aid to ensure laws are consistent with constitutional aims.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following most accurately describes the Preamble's relation to sovereignty?
options: States that the Constitution derives authority from Parliament
States that sovereignty rests with the people ('We, The People of India')
States that sovereignty belongs to a foreign power
States that sovereignty is held by the monarch
quiz.reason: 'We, The People of India' indicates that sovereignty rests with the people.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following is a 'best trick' for remembering that Preamble is used for interpretation?
options: Think of the Preamble as the Constitution's 'compass' guiding interpretation
Remember it as a shopping list
Think of it as a tax manual
quiz.reason: Preamble can be thought of as a compass guiding the interpretation of constitutional provisions.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following statements is CORRECT about the Preamble and the Kesavananda case?
options: Kesavananda held Preamble irrelevant to Basic Structure
Kesavananda held Preamble part of the Constitution and forming part of Basic Structure
quiz.reason: Kesavananda confirmed Preamble's integral role and Basic Structure linkage.

quiz.prompt: Which flashcard question helps revise the Preamble quickly?
options: What are the five words describing the state? (SSCDR)
How many provinces were there in 1800?
Which is the tallest mountain in the world?
What is the capital of France?
quiz.reason: The SSCDR reminder is a focused flashcard for Preamble revision.

quiz.prompt: Which of the following best summarizes the Preamble's relationship to DPSPs?
options: DPSPs are non-binding suggestions that help achieve Preamble's social and economic goals
quiz.reason: Directive Principles, though non-justiciable, guide state policy towards Preamble's aims.

quiz.prompt: Which of these statements about 'Fraternity' is correct?
options: It is about ensuring dignity and national unity
quiz.reason: Fraternity ensures dignity of individual and unity & integrity of the nation.

quiz.prompt: Why is the Preamble considered politically and morally binding though parts may not be directly justiciable?
options: Because it is a short paragraph
Because it embodies the Constitution's core values and forms part of Basic Structure
Because it is a set of rules about taxation
quiz.reason: Its status as part of Constitution and embodiment of core values (Basic Structure) give it moral and political force.

topics.title: Related materials
topics.description: Source snippets and context used to compile these notes.

content.note: This Preamble module consolidates the original notes.json preamble text plus the expanded Hinglish Mnemonic material and 100 MCQs from the chat transcripts and prior drafts. Sources (uploaded files) used: notes.json and chats files.
sources: notes.json (uploaded) ‚Äî used for base text and original structure. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
chat transcripts (uploaded) ‚Äî used for detailed mnemonics, flashcards and question bank. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
